Zabbix Template Module NFS version 1.0.4

Main change on the new version is using "," instead of ";" as separator in the template for more compatibilities

Tested on Zabbix 4.4 up to 5.2

Github : https://github.com/FroggDev/zabbix-nfs

Introduction

Template for zabbix to check nfs share availability using external script.

It can check:

  • If NFS server is accepting request
  • If NFS shares are available
  • The NFS server version

Requirement

The script use the commands showmount & rpcinfo so it requires the linux package nfs-common

To install it you can use the package manager of your distribution

Exemple

apt-get install nfs-common

By the way you may require sudoer rights to run the command.

Installation

Content

The template installation require 2 files:

  • frogg_nfs_check.sh Zabbix external script
  • frogg_nfs_check.xml Zabbix template configuration
  • userparameter_frogg_nfs_check.conf Zabbix shortcut for a clean call

External script

You need to place the script frogg_nfs_check.sh into zabbix external forlder externalscripts (by default in /usr/lib/zabbix/externalscripts or /etc/zabbix/externalscripts)

You can find the external script folder in Zabbix configuration file zabbix_server.conf (by default in /etc/zabbix/zabbix_server.conf)

You will need to add execute permission on the script

chmod +x frogg_nfs_check.sh

User parameters

You need to place the script userparameter_frogg_nfs_check.conf into zabbix userparameter forlder (by default in /etc/zabbix/zabbix_agentd.conf.d/)

You can find the external script folder in Zabbix agent configuration file zabbix_server.conf (by default in /etc/zabbix/zabbix_server.conf)

You may need to create it if it doesn't exist
